channel.title: Help? Please?
channel.description:
Hello I post allot of questions oh well so i decided to do online college and I was told to make a android game
Its supposed to be a racing game -.- well so far I have no idea where to start I'm still learning this but I have Android/sdk I have the android plugin for netbeans nbandroid I honestly need help
Any help is appreciated

item.title: Help? Please?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

There are many tools online that allow you to make an android app without any/minimal coding required.
If you really have to program it yourself, I’m pretty sure that android makes doing things like making a racing game really easy.

Have you looked at the docs yet?

Read full topic

Sounds like someone isn’t turning up to class

[/quote]

item.title: Help? Please?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

simply move the map itself as natty said. would be easier.

only reason i see a visibility field being used here, would be if there were other cars, or objects drawn onto the map itself, perhaps objects to dodge, etc. throw the item in the viewport, define it as visible, and start the rendering, once the map has moved it out of the viewport, define it invisible, stop all rendering, and remove it from any data structure of stored objects you may be using for rendering?

Read full topic

item.title: Help? Please?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:5, topic:540720”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=659585.msg4410890#msg4410890 date=1393617446]
First draw a picture of a car. Then draw a picture of a huge racetrack.

Paint the racetrack to the screen at some negative x,y depending on where you want to start, then paint the car to the centre of the screen. Then move the racetrack paint coordinates around to simulate car movement!
[/quote]
Why make it negative coordinates? All you need is a visible boolean. I’m pretty sure that entities would need a visible/invisibible state in game development.[/quote]I’m talking about moving the map not making it invisible. Why would you want to make it invisible…

Read full topic

item.title: Help? Please?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:4, topic:540720”]First draw a picture of a car. Then draw a picture of a huge racetrack.

Paint the racetrack to the screen at some negative x,y depending on where you want to start, then paint the car to the centre of the screen. Then move the racetrack paint coordinates around to simulate car movement![/quote]
Why make it negative coordinates? All you need is a visible boolean. I’m pretty sure that entities would need a visible/invisibible state in game development.

Read full topic

item.title: Help? Please?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

First draw a picture of a car. Then draw a picture of a huge racetrack.

Paint the racetrack to the screen at some negative x,y depending on where you want to start, then paint the car to the centre of the screen. Then move the racetrack paint coordinates around to simulate car movement!

Read full topic

item.title: Help? Please?
item.dc:creator: @RUNE-PK RUNE-PK
item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:2, topic:540720”]Does it have to be 3D? 2D? How much experience do you even have with Java? Like, do you know how to draw a box to the screen and make it move around?

I’d start by drawing up a plan of how the game will work, covering stuff like the different screens, game modes, maps, cars, points, etc.[/quote]

Just 2D and yes I can draw a box, But I don’t know where to start

Read full topic

item.title: Help? Please?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Does it have to be 3D? 2D? How much experience do you even have with Java? Like, do you know how to draw a box to the screen and make it move around?

I’d start by drawing up a plan of how the game will work, covering stuff like the different screens, game modes, maps, cars, points, etc.

Read full topic
